intro: Gladiolus hajastanicus, commonly known as the Caucasian gladiolus, is a rare and ornamental plant native to the Caucasus region. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its striking, sword-shaped leaves and tall, colorful flower spikes. The plant typically blooms in late summer, producing showy flowers in shades of red, pink, and white. It prefers well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens or as a border plant. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
